content: Huge Map Test is missing u, v, w, violating the guarantee that locations are contiguous starting with letter a

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice one ! This is not too hard, yet quite interesting to do.
It might algo be a good idea to display a second example with more letters to make this easier.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: good and fun  puzzle

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is quite simple yet requires some insight and quick-thinking to solve. Very interesting.
Simple, but a good clash puzzle to test how you think fast

Many thanks for all the feedback so far.

I have made the following changes:

- fixed last sentence as proposed
- removed uppercase/lowercase logic
(I agree with the comment, it is more an annoyance than making the problem interesting)
A good puzzle ! I agree with Nasos, last sentence is confusing.

I think it'd be better to change in last sentence:
`in correct order` -> `in alphabetical order`
As most people like skip reading the whole thing on fastest mode

The part between lowercase & upper case letters seems unnecessarily confusing. 

You could try to just use their ascii values and end of the story or find a simpler way to describe what you want with uppercase & lowercase letters.


The nice core part of your problem is about sorting the positions based on their letters.  The extra logic around uppercase & lowercase letters seems like an artificial way to make the problem more complex. Your problem is already nice without those extra details.

Upvoting.
The border seems to be unnecessary. Maybe remove it completely?

Upvoted. I just solved it without reading statement due to reverse mode selection, it's fastly guessable. 
In the statement, mentionning that top left corner of map starts at (0, 0) should be enough and clearer.

Without seeing the example "The top left coordinate of the map is 1,1" is confusing:
- are the borders considered part of the map?
- so, is the top left border "*" at 0,0 or 1,1?
Your diagram makes this worse, as it shows "1,1" TWO rows below the top border.

I think it would be clearer to say that "The top left coordinate of the map (including the border) is 0,0"

You don't specify whether the location letters need to be contiguous (could there be 3 locations marked A, B and F?)

I'd suggest additional constraint of "number of treasure locations <= 26"

"Can you finish the quest before the other contestants?" seems unnecessary, especially for Reverse mode

I came up with the idea for reverse mode (no descriptions) and decided to add a description for the other modes as well. 

Totally agree that the map in description does not help to understand.
I tried to make it shorter and less confusing.
Thanks for feedback, I adjusted the text a little bit after getting inspiration from the A child play exercise

It't pretty easy to guess already in reverse mode, I am actually tempted to do the opposite and add some extra characters or ascii art.

For now I added a sentence to make it extra clear that borders to not have a special meaning.

I'm open to additional feedback.

-> changed to WIP
